title: PTD Today — Media

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Daniel Tom, 31, owns Bay Area Sanitation, which operates nearly 2,000 portable toilets serving construction sites and events across the San Francisco Bay Area. The company reported $4.3 million in total income in 2025.
bullets: Owner: Daniel Tom, 31.
Company: Bay Area Sanitation.
Fleet size: almost 2,000 portable toilets.
Service area: San Francisco Bay Area; customers include construction sites and events.
2025 total income: $4.3 million.
takeaways: Niche service businesses can generate multi-million-dollar revenue, indicating customer demand resilience in basic services.
Managing a large regional fleet underscores the importance of logistics and operational scalability when assessing infrastructure needs.
Serving both construction and events suggests demand diversification, which can stabilize revenue streams across market cycles.
Regional market strength (Bay Area) can support higher-than-expected revenue — factor local economic conditions into capacity planning.

Explore Copilot Groups for potential improvements in scheduling and coordination workflows where routes matter.

items.title: Audyt w erze AI: praktyczne zastosowania i realne korzyści | Katarzyna Chojniak, Alicja Barska

ai.summary: Based on the available description… KPMG Poland experts Katarzyna Chojniak and Alicja Barska discuss how AI is already embedded in modern audit workflows, illustrating practical tools and platforms (like AI Transaction Scoring and KPMG Clara) that enable full-population analyses, conversational assistants, real-time management and improved client communication. They also cover impacts on auditors’ roles, required competencies, implementation challenges, data security/regulatory considerations and potential risks of AI in audit.
bullets: AI Transaction Scoring enables analysis of entire data populations rather than sampling.
Clara AI provides conversational assistance and specialized agents to support audit tasks.
KPMG Clara platform offers real-time audit management and Clara for Clients modernizes client communication.
AI helps with documentation and disclosure analysis, changing auditors’ workflows and skill needs.
Discussion includes implementation challenges, data security, regulatory context and future risks.
takeaways: Expect more comprehensive assurance as audits move from sampling to full-population analysis—plan for more detailed data access and audit-ready logging.
Real-time audit platforms and client portals can speed reporting and improve transparency—evaluate integration with your systems.
Data security and regulatory compliance are central—ensure encryption, access controls and audit trails before sharing operational data.
Operational teams should prepare for new evidence formats and potential changes in audit cadence as AI-driven processes are adopted.
Invest in staff skills and documentation practices to support AI-enabled audits and to respond to queries about model use and outcomes.

items.title: Arknights: Endfield | 4K NVIDIA DLSS 4 Launch Trailer

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Arknights: Endfield has officially launched and the trailer highlights NVIDIA DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation. The game is described as a 3D real-time strategy RPG where you play the Endministrator of Endfield Industries on Talos-II; the trailer footage was captured on a GeForce RTX 5080 at 4K Ultra Settings using DLSS 4 Multi Frame Generation 4X Mode.
bullets: Official launch of Arknights: Endfield with DLSS 4 Multi Frame Generation featured.
Game type: 3D real-time strategy RPG; player role — Endministrator of Endfield Industries on Talos-II.
Trailer capture: GeForce RTX 5080, 4K Ultra Settings, DLSS 4 Multi Frame Generation 4X Mode.
Description includes links to NVIDIA DLSS 4 announcement and the game's official site.
Social channels listed for Arknights: Endfield and NVIDIA GeForce (X, YouTube, Instagram, Facebook, TikTok).
takeaways: Trailer demonstrates DLSS 4 Multi Frame Generation running on an RTX 5080 at 4K — note this capability when evaluating GPU requirements for high‑resolution real‑time rendering workloads.
Presence of DLSS 4 integration in a newly launched title signals a need to consider driver and SDK compatibility for deployments that must support advanced NVIDIA features.
Captured 4K Ultra Settings footage implies demand for GPUs and infrastructure that can handle 4K real‑time rendering workloads for game capture, streaming, or visualization services.
